column4: i think /etc/rclocal affects all users... how do i make it specific to my user only?
you don't. run it in the user's startup script?
where is the user startup script?
in your ~
whats the ~/startupscript file called?
all vlc "codecs" are compiled in. they can't be missing
any idea of whats wrong with my glx on my 9200 -> glxinfo -> http://pastebin.com/m1fe99cda
direct rendering: No (If you want to find out why, try setting LIBGL_DEBUG=verbose)
where do i set that?
xoeg.conf?
so I did export LIBGL_DEBUG=verbose, now what?
now you run glxinfo in the same sehll
where the env var is set (you can check with "env")
done, can you take a look at this? http://pastebin.com/m52f57920
libGL error: dlopen /usr/lib/dri/r200_dri.so failed (/usr/lib/dri/r200_dri.so: undefined symbol: _glapi_Dispatch)
translated into engrish
your driver file is wrong. where did you get it?
, came with Ubuntu
libgl1-mesa-dri: /usr/lib/dri/r200_dri.so
are you a video driver developr?
thanks i'll try but i doubt it
Agent_bob, I can't remember i think it was a gutsy upgrade or a clean install
